title: Logo Design for Salon - Panache
content:
Here are my preliminary designs for a logo for a salon called Panache. They just did a complete remodel and would like a new logo to reflect their new look. The following is a brief description I was given of the salon:

Main Colors…Copper/Shimmer Bronze

Contemporary & Classy/Modern

Brushed Steel Benches with Black Leather

Straight Lines

Silver w/Black accents

Taupe w/Green in it

Soft Blue shimmer in massage area

This is a link to the styling chairs for the salon…they are black [http://www.takarabelmont.com/custom\_express\_plus/color\_config.wu?categid...](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106090524/http:/www.takarabelmont.com/custom_express_plus/color_config.wu?categid=0049&photoid=0695 "http://www.takarabelmont.com/custom\_express\_plus/color\_config.wu?categid=0049&photoid=0695")

Let me know what you think.... the last one was just for fun. :)

| UPDATE 11-30-07 |

I have posted some new ideas based on feedback from the client. What you think?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Panache Proofs.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20131106090524/http:/typophile.com/files/Panache%20Proofs.pdf) | 133.98 KB |
author: westongd

comments.content: I don’t really feel like any of these really work. A & B look dated, like something I saw on a shampoo bottle a few years ago. C & D are just gratuitous and don’t reflect high-style. E looks like you were starting something and walked away from it in the middle of merging some letters, F looks like it goes on an environmentally-friendly kids product.
Thanks for your input James. Do you have any suggestions as to which direction I should pursue... Are there any of these I should try to develop more or should I just go back to the drawing board?
I think D had the most potential. Fits the brief best. I would work on that.
